required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CLINICAL OUTCOME OF ENDOTRACHEAL INTUBATION IN NON-TRAUMA PATIENTS
clinical_study.official_title: CLINICAL OUTCOME OF ENDOTRACHEAL INTUBATION IN NON-TRAUMA PATIENTS IN THE EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT OF ALEXANDRIA MAIN UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL

brief_summary.textblock: The study will involve all adult patients visiting the Alexandria University main hospitals' Emergency department for reasons other than trauma that will require assisted ventilation via endotracheal intubation. Those pre-intubated or intubated post CPR will not be included. The main aim is to evaluate the clinical outcome (complications) of emergency endotracheal intubation and to correlate the incidence and nature of complications associated with tracheal intubations to demographic data and patient characteristics.

primary_outcome.description: Severe hypoxemia, Cardiac arrest, Cardiovascular collapse, Death

secondary_outcome.description: Cardiac arrhythmia, Esophageal intubation, Aspiration, Dental injury, Difficulty intubation, Agitation

clinical_study.condition: To Evaluate the Clinical Outcome (Complications) of Emergency Endotracheal Intubation in Non-traumatic Patients

arm_group.description: Male patients will be compared to female patients with regards to incidence of complications
Various age groups will be evaluated to determine vulnerable age groups

intervention.description: Evaluate incidence of first trial success and complications

study_pop.textblock: Patients who meet the required criteria and consent to the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients of both sex with a life threatening impairment of the cardiovascular, respiratory or neurological system requiring emergency endotracheal intubation in the emergency department of Alexandria Main University Hospital.
Exclusion Criteria:
- â€¢ Patients who are less than 18 years of age.
- Patients intubated out of the hospital.
- Trauma patients.
- Patients intubated for cardiac arrest.
- Failed intubation in the field
